status.name: Closed

fields.description:
h5.Description
Packaging the application works fine. I can run the application on devices and simulators without any errors.

However when I try to upload the packaged application to the windows store I get errors shown in the attached picture.

h5.Steps To Reproduce
1. Create a hybrid application
2. Package the application for Windows Store
3. Sign into a Windows Developer account
4. Submit the application to be published

h5.Expected Result
Packaged application should be okay to publish to the Windows store.

h5.Actual Result
I get errors about the apps packages being incorrect.
fields.summary: Windows Hybrid: Cannot publish to Windows appstore using VS2013
fields.environment:
Windows 8.1
Titanium Studio, build: 3.2.0.201312181641
Titanium SDK, build: 3.2.0.v20131218160416 (hybrid)
CLI: 3.2.0-cr3
Alloy: 1.3.0-cr2

comments.body:
h5.Extra Information

You cannot upload the .appxupload file generated by the CLI build.
However if you open the generated .sln file in Visual Studio and package to .appxupload it will successfully upload to the Windows Store.

h5.Steps To Reproduce
1. Create a hybrid application
2. Package the application for Windows Store
3. Open the .sln file in the build folder in Visual Studio
4. Select "Project -> Store -> Create app packages"
5. Run through the packaging wizard
6. Upload the generated .appxupload file to the Windows dev center
Note that you can work around this just by opening up the solution in Visual Studio and doing the packaging manually.
Closing ticket as Windows Hybrid is no longer supported.
